intro: Rubus × quadraticiformis, commonly known as the blackberry bramble, is a hybrid plant belonging to the Rosaceae family. It is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces aggregate fruits known as drupes, which are typically dark purple to black in color. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in woodland edges and disturbed soils. Due to its vigorous growth, it can become invasive in certain regions.
